1.text: Purchase silk or synthetic organza in any color.

2.text: Cut out 2 or 3 circular templates in a few different widths.

3.text: Lay the templates on the fabric and cut at least 5 or 6 fabric circles.

4.text: Hold the edge of a fabric circle above a candle flame to singe it.

5.text: Stack your curled layers from largest to smallest.

6.text: Thread a needle and sew through the center to hold the flower in place.

7.text: Tie the thread and trim the tail.

8.text: Cut a strip of organza so it's 3 to 4 inches (7.6 to 10.2 cm) wide.

9.text: Fold the strip of fabric into a rectangle.

10.text: Cut the top of the folded fabric to make a curved edge.

11.text: Hold the scalloped edges over a candle flame if you want to curl the petals.

12.text: Fold the strip of fabric in half crosswise and thread a needle.

13.text: Work a running stitch across the bottom of the folded fabric strip.

14.text: Pull the thread to gather the flower and sew the bottom of the flower.

15.text: Cut the thread and trim the excess to finish your flower.

16.text: Choose 1 color or a few complementary shades to make flowers.

17.text: Create small flowers if you want to attach them to jewelry, cards, or headbands.

18.text: Make large organza flowers to create wreaths or home decor projects.

19.text: Assemble a custom flower bouquet with organza flowers.
